author: David Grubb
title: Pelicans Host Jazz Looking to Avoid Fourth Straight Loss at Home - The Bird Writes
text: NEW ORLEANS – The New Orleans Pelicans have not given their fans much reason for holiday cheer, having lost three of their last four games, with all of those defeats happening inside the walls of the Smoothie King Center. Worse than that, the losses have come in horrible fashion, with the Pelicans squandering fourth quarter leads in each game. In fact, nine of their 14 losses this season have come in games where New Orleans has held a double-digit lead. The Pels are 5-8 in clutch games this season, and 0-9 in games decided by three points or less. During these last four games, they’ve failed to find any semblance of rhythm or fight when the games have mattered most. |Category||Game (Rank)||4Q (Rank)| |ORTG||114.9 (19)||106.5 (26)| |DRTG||110.8 (4)||138.7 (30)| |NET||4.1 (11)||-32.2 (30)| |AST/TO||1.84 (18)||1.36 (27)| |REB%||49.9 (16)||40.0 (30)| |TOV%||12.9 (12)||15.2 (26)| |TS%||57.6 (21)||55.0 (22)| |Pace||96.73 (29)||92.5 (23)| |Possessions||396 (23)||92 (26)| The production of the Pels’ “Big 3” of Zion Williamson, Brandon Ingram, and CJ McCollum in the fourth quarter has dropped compared to last season. So far, the trio is posting averages of 15.5 points, 3.9 rebounds, 3.2 assists, and 1.8 turnovers in the final frame, with an average +/- of -1.96 (51.3 FG%, 38.7 3P%, 71.0 FT%). During the 2022-23 campaign they averaged 17.7 pts, 3.5 rebs, 3.7 asts, and 1.8 turnovers, with an average +/- of 1.3 (50.7 FG%, 38.4 3P%, 72.2 FT%). That’s a swing of -3.26 in the wrong direction. Tonight’s opponent, the Utah Jazz, are already 2-0 versus the Pelicans this season. Those wins came by a total of seven points. In the first meeting, New Orleans led by nine heading into the fourth quarter before being dominated in the fourth quarter and outscored by 13 points. In the second, the Jazz made enough plays to hold off the Pelicans late and squeeze out a two-point victory. Utah was left for dead after the departures of Donovan Mitchell and Rudy Gobert, but they have continued to be a pest for the Pelicans, winning five in a row against New Orleans since the start of last season. Following the Jazz, the Pelicans face a nine-game stretch of playoff contenders that will take them right up to the halfway point of the season. With the fluid nature of the Western Conference, a poor run through those games could take New Orleans from the middle to the bottom of the pack in the race for the postseason. The New Orleans Pelicans, five years into the Zion Williamson/David Griffin era, are still in search of an identify and waiting for a leader to emerge. Until those things happen, every game will continue to be a coin toss as to knowing which Pelicans team will show up. That’s not what was expected at this stage of the process. The Pelicans should be better. The fans deserve better. Is better still a viable option? That remains to be seen. Most Recent Starting Lineups |Utah Jazz||New Orleans Pelicans| |G – Kris Dunn||G – CJ McCollum| |G – Collin Suxton||G – Herb Jones| |F – Lauri Markkanen||F – Brandon Ingram| |F – Kelly Olynyk||F – Zion Williamson| |C – John Collins||C – Jonas Valanciunas| Injuries New Orleans Pelicans: Matt Ryan (right elbow surgery) is Out. Cody Zeller (right ankle sprain) is Questionable. Larry Nance Jr. (right rib fracture) is Probable. Utah Jazz: Simone Fontecchio (illness) is Questionable. Who: Utah Jazz (13-18) at New Orleans Pelicans (17-14) Season Series: - Nov. 25: Jazz def. Pelicans, 105-100 - Nov. 27: Jazz def. Pelicans, 114-112 - Dec. 28: Jazz at Pelicans - Jan. 23: Jazz at Pelicans Where: Smoothie King Center When: Dec. 28, 7:00 PM CT Where to watch: Bally Sports New Orleans Where to listen: [WRNO 99.5](https://wrno.iheart.com/) For more content, visit [HITP Sports](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdobFntJURJ4HzZjx241VYg) on YouTube or [HITP Sports](https://hitpsports.com/) online. author: /cronologia/-/meta/lesly-chambasis
title: Sectores políticos en contra del Foro de Sao Paulo
text: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.-En el marco de la celebración de las asambleas del Foro de Sao Paulo, diversos sectores de la oposición política reiteraron su rechazo a la llegada a Honduras de líderes y exmandatarios de la izquierda de América. “Un foro ideológico que trae los países de izquierda y que hoy Honduras se encuentra sumergida en una crisis de seguridad, energía, desempleo, migración y lo que prioriza el gobierno de la refundación son foros que más allá de traer la inversión extranjera nos aleja con la mala imagen el Foro de Sao Paulo a nivel de Latinoamérica”, cuestionó la diputada nacionalista, María Antonieta Mejía. Por su parte, la parlamentaria Claudia Ramírez, del Partido Salvador de Honduras (PSH), indicó que Honduras está a las puertas de una lucha cultural a través del foro de Sao Paulo, el que calificó como un cáncer que avanza como una metástasis que se extiende en América Latina. “En parte sí estamos blindados porque hay una historia que nos avala, hay una verdad que los hondureños, los políticos y oposición abramos los ojos”, exhortó la parlamentaria. De su lado, el general en condición de retiro, Romeo Vásquez Velásquez, señaló que “lo único que puede detener el avance de esta ideología que viene a destruir el país y también atenta contra la iniciativa privada y contra la libertad, es que el pueblo diga basta”. Continúo: “Ellos (Manuel Zelaya y Xiomara Castro) están en un proyecto ambicioso y de ambición para Honduras, porque no es una ambición para Honduras, sino que es personal”. El sábado a las 9:00 de la mañana, el Ejército Ciudadano de Paz convocó a una movilización ante el rechazo de la celebración de sesiones del Foro de Sao Paulo en el país. En rechazo a su llegada, este jueves líderes del Partido Nacional de la corriente interna del precandidato y exedil capitalino Nasry Asfura anunciaron se sumarán a la movilización convocada por el bloque ciudadano en contra del Foro. “Hemos recibido la invitación y confirmamos nuestra presencia en la marcha. Convocamos a toda la coordinación y dirigencia de nuestro movimiento en la capital, a que marchemos por Honduras este próximo sábado 29 de junio, vestidos de blanco”, anunció el aspirante a la alcaldía, Juan Diego Zelaya. El precandidato a la comuna del Distrito Central, reiteró que su postura en contra del Foro es a nivel de movimiento interno y no como institución, por lo que llamo a la clase política a no permanecer tibios ante la situación. En conmemoración a los 15 años del golpe de Estado al derrocado mandatario Manuel Zelaya, el Foro de Sao Paulo realizará varios encuentros en el país a partir de este jueves, concluyendo sus reuniones el sábado 29 de junio.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Canisius Falls Short in Loss to St. Bonaventure
text:
Canisius Falls Short in Loss to St. Bonaventure
By the Numbers
Canisius men's soccer faced defeat against St. Bonaventure, losing 2-1 despite a strong offensive effort in the second half. The Bonnies opened the scoring early, with goals from Andres Javitt and Luc Finelli. Although Canisius cut the deficit with a goal from Edson Flores, they were unable to capitalize on multiple late scoring opportunities. As a result, Canisius falls to 0-3-0 in non-conference play, while St. Bonaventure secures their first victory of the season.
- Canisius outshot St. Bonaventure 17-14, including a 10-9 edge on corner kicks.
- Edson Flores' goal marked his first of the season and first of his collegiate career.
- St. Bonaventure leads the all-time series against Canisius with a record of 28-18-9.
Despite Canisius dominating the shot count, their inability to convert scoring chances in the closing minutes illustrates ongoing struggles in finishing plays. Defensive efforts, notably by senior Kodie Sarkodie, bolstered their effort, yet the Griffs remain winless this season.State of Play
- Canisius remains winless at 0-3-0 after three non-conference matches.
- St. Bonaventure marked their first win of the season, improving to 1-2-0.
The Griffs will host Central Connecticut State for a Labor Day matchup at 1:00 p.m., aiming to turn their fortunes around and secure their first win of the season.Bottom Line
Canisius must capitalize on scoring opportunities in upcoming matches to shift their current trajectory; a focus on offensive execution will be crucial as they continue their non-conference schedule.
Read more at
 Canisius University Athletics

author: Rishav Kothari
title: Multiday lake-effect snow to blanket parts of New York and Pennsylvania with heavy snow
text:
By Rishav Kothari ,
1 hours ago A multiday lake-effect snowstorm is expected to bring significant snowfall across New York. Areas downwind of Lake Ontario and Lake Erie in Upstate New York and northwestern Pennsylvania could receive several feet of snow due to the event, lasting through Sunday, January 5. author: Salman Khan
title: Boca West Children's Foundation Hosts 12th Annual Golf Challenge for Charity
text:
On March 25, 2024, the Boca West Country Club will buzz with excitement as more than 400 golf enthusiasts gather for a noble cause at the 12th Annual Boca West Children's Foundation Golf Challenge. This esteemed event aims to raise funds for over 30 children's charities across Palm Beach County, promising a day filled with sportsmanship and philanthropy.
Community and Charity Unite
The Golf Challenge has become a staple event in Palm Beach County, drawing participants and spectators alike to support the local community. Pamela Weinroth, the executive director of the Boca West Children's Foundation, highlights the importance of the event, "The Golf Challenge is an annual fundraiser, and so many people from the community participate in our shared effort to support local kids." Non-golfers are also encouraged to join the fun by attending the cocktail reception and dinner, ensuring that everyone has a chance to contribute.
Exciting Events and Generous Donations
The day kicks off with registration and brunch at 11 a.m., followed by a unique duck drop event at 12:30 p.m., where participants have a shot at winning $2,500. The golf challenge itself starts at 1 p.m., with a cocktail reception, dinner, and live auction rounding off the evening. The competition is fierce as charities vie for a portion of the $100,000 awarded during the tournament, with each charity guaranteed to receive between $3,000 and $15,000 depending on their team's performance.
Impact Beyond the Green
Since its inception, the Boca West Children's Foundation has granted over $18 million to projects serving at-risk youth. This year's Golf Challenge is yet another opportunity to add to that impressive total, providing essential support to those in need within the Palm Beach County community. It's a testament to the power of collective effort and the difference it can make in the lives of local children.
The Boca West Children's Foundation's 12th Annual Golf Challenge is more than just a day of golf; it's a celebration of community spirit and the profound impact of philanthropy. As participants and spectators come together, they are reminded of the significant difference they can make, one swing at a time.

organizations.name: 12th annual boca west children's foundation golf challenge

author: JULIETA GUTIÉRREZ PÉREZ
title: ¿Cómo estará el clima en Hidalgo este viernes 29 de diciembre? | La Silla Rota
text: PACHUCA.- Helado, lluvioso y con temperaturas de -5 a 0 grados, es el pronóstico del clima para el estado de [Hidalgo ](https://lasillarota.com/hidalgo/estado/2023/12/28/pueblos-magicos-de-hidalgo-lugares-para-celebrar-el-ano-nuevo-2024-463000.html)en este viernes 29 de diciembre, antepenúltimo día del año 2023. De acuerdo con el último informe del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional de la Comisión Nacional del Agua (Conagua) que indica las condiciones climatológicas que se presentan se deben al frente frío número 20 que se extenderá sobre el Mar Caribe y el sureste mexicano. Por la mañana de este viernes se esperan heladas en las zonas montañosas de la sierra y huasteca [hidalguense ](https://lasillarota.com/hidalgo/estado/2023/12/28/se-incendia-arbol-de-navidad-en-la-plaza-principal-de-este-municipio-de-hidalgo-video-462936.html)donde el termómetro estará por debajo de los cero grados Celsius. Asimismo, se prevé caída de aguanieve en algunas regiones altas de [Hidalgo](https://lasillarota.com/hidalgo/estado/2023/12/28/rescatan-venado-cola-blanca-herido-en-hidalgo-fotos-462970.html). Respecto a las lluvias se pronostica se presenten con intensidad fuerte. [ÚNETE A NUESTRO CANAL DE WHATSAPP. EL PODER DE LA INFORMACIÓN EN LA PALMA DE TU MANO](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va6evSkGk1Ftej78ks0B) Te podría interesar Las lluvias en [Hidalgo ](https://lasillarota.com/hidalgo/local/2023/12/28/estos-son-los-conciertos-en-pachuca-que-no-te-puedes-perder-en-2024-462940.html)pueden ir acompañadas de viento con rachas de 50 a 60 kilómetros por hora. La Conagua pide a la población mantenerse informado y en contacto con los elementos de Protección Civil en caso de un aumento en el nivel de agua en ríos, lagos y otros mantos acuíferos; así como deslaves y derrumbes en las vías carreteras. Los municipios que presentan mayor probabilidad de lluvia son: Huejutla de Reyes con temperaturas de 18 a 14 grados Celsius; Jacala donde el termómetro marca los 12 y 7 grados en la máxima y mínima respectivamente; Zacualtipán con temperaturas entre 9 y 5 grados; Huehuetla con 17 y 13 grados; Tula de Allende con 18 y 6 grados; Tulancingo entre 13 y 5 grados; Tizayuca marca 18 en la máxima y 4 grados en la temperatura mínima; Apan llega a los 0 grados y la máxima de 16. Te podría interesar Para la zona metropolitana de Pachuca se esperan temperaturas de 13 grados Celsius la máxima y 3 grados la mínima que se registra. Las probabilidades de lluvia son de un 5 por ciento con el cielo mayormente despejado. El sol puede salir, sin embargo, el clima frío prevalecerá durante la mañana y noche de este viernes 29 de diciembre. Estos son los últimos días del año 2023, y el frío continuará, por lo que se le pide a la población tomar las medidas para abrigarse y mantener el calor corporal para evitar las enfermedades respiratorias. De igual forma estar informado en las páginas www.gob.mx/conagua y https://smn.conagua.gob.mx, en las cuentas de X @conagua_mx y @conagua_clima, y de Facebook www.facebook.com/conaguamx, así como en la aplicación para dispositivos móviles ConaguaClima, donde se puede consultar el pronóstico por municipio. jgp

author: PODER360
title: “Ouviu, Amorim?”, diz aliado de Maduro após tribunal confirmar vitória
text:
O presidente da Assembleia Nacional da Venezuela, Jorge Rodríguez , comparou as eleições do país com as do Brasil e ironizou Celso Amorim, assessor especial da Presidência da República. Segundo o chavista, o TSJ (Tribunal Supremo de Justiça) validou o resultado do pleito de 28 de julho assim como o TSE (Tribunal Superior Eleitoral) fez em 2022.
“É importante dizer que a sentença do TSJ não é apenas na Venezuela onde está a jurisdição superior da sala eleitoral, mas também no Brasil –ouviu, senhor Celso Amorim?–, no México, nos Estados Unidos e no mundo inteiro. Há uma jurisdição superior” , declarou nesta 5ª feira (22.ago.2024) em sessão do Parlamento.
Formulário de cadastro alertas grátis do Poder360 concordo com os termos da LGPD . Inscreva-se Inscreva-se Amorim foi enviado pelo governo do presidente Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva (PT) à Venezuela para acompanhar a realização do pleito e manteve diálogo com o presidente Nicolás Maduro (Partido Socialista Unido da Venezuela, esquerda).
Em entrevista à CNN , o assessor do petista sugeriu uma nova eleição. Como mostrou o Poder360 , a proposta de Lula já foi rejeitada por Maduro.
“Se ambos os lados dizem que venceram, por que não realizar outra eleição em que se possam evitar os problemas que, dizem, contaminaram essa eleição? Se ela ganhou, provavelmente ganhará de novo, não?” , perguntou Amorim.
No entanto, nesta 5ª feira (22.ago), o TSJ validou a vitória do chavista nas eleições e destacou o “respaldo pelos registros emitidos pelas máquinas e total coincidência com os bancos de dados” , mas informou que não tornará as atas eleitorais públicas.
Edmundo González, líder da oposição, rejeitou a decisão da Corte, baseando-se em uma contagem paralela que indicaria sua vitória.
A disputa presidencial na Venezuela foi marcada por alegações de parcialidade e falta de independência do CNE (Conselho Nacional Eleitoral) e do TSJ, ambos alinhados ao governo.
O Centro Carter criticou o pleito por não atender aos padrões internacionais de integridade eleitoral, indicando um “claro viés” em favor de Maduro.
A OEA (Organização dos Estados Americanos) e uma missão do Conselho de Direitos Humanos da ONU demonstraram preocupação com a falta de independência das instituições venezuelanas. A OEA não reconheceu o resultado divulgado pelo CNE e solicitou a publicação das atas.
A decisão do TSJ desta 5ª feira (22.ago) também implica em sanções contra González por suposto desacato à Justiça, aumentando as tensões políticas no país.
